jparsec.ephem

Class Functions

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.ephem.Functions

  • public class Functions
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides methods for manipulating angles or vectors, and formatting strings.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

      • getQuadrant

        public static int getQuadrant(double radians)
        Returns the quadrant (0, 1, 2, or 3) of the specified angle.

        This function is useful in figuring out dates of lunar phases and solstices/equinoxes. If the solar longitude is in one quadrant at the start of a day, but in a different quadrant at the end of a day, then we know that there must have been a solstice or equinox during that day. Also, if (lunar longitude - solar longitude) changes quadrants between the start of a day and the end of a day, we know there must have been a lunar phase change during that day.

        Parameters:
        radians - Angle in Radians.
        Returns:
        Quadrant of angle (0, 1, 2, or 3).

      • formatDEC

        public static java.lang.String formatDEC(double dec)
        Format declination. Significant digits are adapted to common ephemeris precision.
        Parameters:
        dec - Declination in radians. Must be in the range -Pi/2 to +Pi/2.
        Returns:
        String with the format $##º ##' ##.###'' ($ is the sign).

      • formatRA

                        int nsec)
        Format right ascension. Significant digits are adapted to common ephemeris precision.
        Parameters:
        ra - Right ascension in radians.
        nsec - Number of decimal places in seconds of time.
        Returns:
        String with the format ##h ##m ##.##...s.

      • formatRAWithNegativeTime

        public static java.lang.String formatRAWithNegativeTime(double ra0,
                                        int nsec)
        Format right ascension. Significant digits are adapted to common ephemeris precision. In case the RA is negative a minus sign is used.
        Parameters:
        ra0 - Right ascension in radians.
        nsec - Number of decimal places in seconds of time.
        Returns:
        String with the format ##h ##m ##.##...s.

      • formatValue

        public static java.lang.String formatValue(double val,
                           int decimals)
        Format a real number.
        Parameters:
        val - Numerical value
        decimals - Number of decimal places.
        Returns:

      • formatValue

        public static java.lang.String formatValue(double val,
                           int decimals,
                           int nondecimals,
                           boolean roundUp)
        Format a real number.
        Parameters:
        val - Numerical value
        decimals - Number of decimal places.
        nondecimals - Number of non-decimal places.
        roundUp - True to round up the value in case the number of non-decimal places is lower than the required to represent the entire value (so rounding is needed). If false, the value will be rounded down in case the last significant digit is below 5, and up if it is 5 or greater. If unsure, select false.
        Returns:
        String with the adequate format.

      • formatAngle

        public static java.lang.String formatAngle(double val,
                           int secDecimals)
        Formats an angle. For low values the degrees/minutes parts are skipped when are null. For angles above +260 degrees, the value is represented as a negative angle.
        Parameters:
        val - Numerical value representing an angle
        secDecimals - Number of decimal places in the arcseconds.
        Returns:
        String with the adequate format.

      • formatAngleAsDegrees

        public static java.lang.String formatAngleAsDegrees(double val,
                                    int decimals)
        Formats an angle as degrees only. For angles above +260 degrees the value is represented as a negative angle.
        Parameters:
        val - Numerical value representing an angle in radians.
        decimals - Number of decimal places in the degrees.
        Returns:
        String with the adequate format.

      • parseRightAscension

        public static double parseRightAscension(java.lang.String ra)
        Returns right ascension in radians given a formatted string.
        Parameters:
        ra - Right Ascension as a string ##h ##m ##.#...s, or ##h #.#...m. Numbers separated by blank spaces are also supported, in the order hour, minutes, seconds.
        Returns:
        Right ascension value in radians.

      • parseDeclination

        public static double parseDeclination(java.lang.String dec)
        Returns declination in radians given a formatted string. Numbers separated by blank spaces are also supported, in the order degrees, minutes, seconds.
        Parameters:
        dec - Declination as a string ##º ##' ##.#...'', or ##º #.#...'. 'd' is allowed instead of 'º'.
        Returns:
        Declination value in radians.

      • getDMSs

        public static double[] getDMSs(double dec)
        Separates a DEC value into degrees, minutes, and seconds of arc.
        Parameters:
        dec - The input declination in radians.
        Returns:
        D, M, and S of arc, and sign in the fourth component. The sign is 1 if DEC is positive, and -1 if it is negative.

                             throws JPARSECException

        Parameters:

        v1 - Vector 2.
        Returns:
        Cross product.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If the size of any of the input vectors is not 3.

      • equalVectors

        public static boolean equalVectors(double[] v1,
                   double[] v2)
        Check if the components of two vectors are equal or not. Velocities are also check if they are present. The sizes of the vectors are not check, since one could have velocities and the other no, for example.
        Parameters:
        v1 - First vector
        v2 - Second vector.
        Returns:
        True if the components are equal, false otherwise.

      • roundUpToPlace

        public static double roundUpToPlace(double value,
                    int place)
        Rounds a floating point number up to the desired decimal place. Example: 1346.4667 rounded up to the 2nd place = 1400.

        Method by Joseph A. Huwaldt.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to be rounded up.
        place - Number of decimal places to round value to. A place of 1 rounds to 10's place, 2 to 100's place, -2 to 1/100th place, et cetera.
        Returns:
        The rounded value.

      • roundToPlace

        public static double roundToPlace(double value,
                  int place)
        Rounds a floating point number to the desired decimal place. Example: 1346.4667 rounded to the 2nd place = 1300.

        Method by Joseph A. Huwaldt.

        Parameters:
        value - The value to be rounded.
        place - Number of decimal places to round value to. A place of 1 rounds to 10's place, 2 to 100's place, -2 to 1/100th place, et cetera.
        Returns:
        The rounded value.

      • roundDownToPlace

        public static double roundDownToPlace(double value,
                      int place)
        Rounds a floating point number down to the desired decimal place. Example: 1346.4667 rounded down to the 1st place = 1340. Method by Joseph A. Huwaldt.
        Parameters:
        value - The value to be rounded down.
        place - Number of decimal places to round value to. A place of 1 rounds to 10's place, 2 to 100's place, -2 to 1/100th place, et cetera.
        Returns:
        The rounded value.

      • doubleToString

        public static java.lang.String doubleToString(double value,
                              int afterDecimalPoint)
        Rounds a double and converts it into String.

        Method by Joseph A. Huwaldt.

        Parameters:
        value - the double value
        afterDecimalPoint - the (maximum) number of digits permitted after the decimal point
        Returns:
        the double as a formatted string

      • doubleToString

        public static java.lang.String doubleToString(double value,
                              int width,
                              int afterDecimalPoint)
        Rounds a double and converts it into a formatted decimal-justified String. Trailing 0's are replaced with spaces.

        Method by Joseph A. Huwaldt.

        Parameters:
        value - the double value
        width - the width of the string
        afterDecimalPoint - the number of digits after the decimal point
        Returns:
        the double as a formatted string

      • getCircleContainingThreeObjects

        public static LocationElement getCircleContainingThreeObjects(LocationElement lo1,
                                              LocationElement lo2,
                                              LocationElement lo3)
        Computes the minimum spherical circle containing three celestial bodies located quite close to each other.
        Parameters:
        lo1 - Location of first object.
        lo2 - Location of second object.
        lo3 - Location of third object.
        Returns:
        The location of the center of the triangle, and its radius in radians.

      • getCircleContainingThreeObjects

        public static double[] getCircleContainingThreeObjects(java.awt.geom.Point2D p1,
                                       java.awt.geom.Point2D p2,
                                       java.awt.geom.Point2D p3)
        Computes the circle containing three positions.
        Parameters:
        p1 - Location of first object.
        p2 - Location of second object.
        p3 - Location of third object.
        Returns:
        Three values: center x, center y, and radius. In case it cannot be determined (straight line) null is returned.

      • getDistanceToSameGreatCircle

        public static double getDistanceToSameGreatCircle(LocationElement loc1,
                                  LocationElement loc2,
                                  LocationElement loc3)
        Returns a value proportional to the distance of three bodies to the same great circle on the celestial sphere. Maybe used to get the time when three bodies are in straight line. See Meeus, chapter 18.
        Parameters:
        loc1 - Position of object 1.
        loc2 - Position of object 2.
        loc3 - Position of object 3.
        Returns:
        A value that will be 0 if the three bodies are in straight line.

      • fmt

        public static java.lang.String fmt(int i,
                   int w)
        Format a String representation of an integer at the specified width.

        Note that this function will return an incorrect representation if the integer is wider than the specified width. For example:
        fmt( 1, 3 ) will return "001".
        fmt( 12, 3 ) will return "012".
        fmt( 1234, 3 ) will return "234."

        Parameters:
        i - The integer to format.
        w - The format width.
        Returns:
        A formatted String.

      • fmt

        public static java.lang.String fmt(int i,
                   int w,
                   char suffix)
        Format a String representation of an integer at the specified width, and add the specified suffix.

        Note that this will return an incorrect representation if the integer is wider than the specified width. For example:
        fmt( 1, 3, ':' ) will return "001:".
        fmt( 12, 3, ':' ) will return "012:".
        fmt( 1234, 3, ':' ) will return "234:."

        Parameters:
        i - The integer to format.
        w - The format width.
        suffix - The character to append.
        Returns:
        A formatted String.

      • getColor

        public static int getColor(int r,
           int g,
           int b,
           int a)
        Returns the RGBA color given their components in the range 0-255.
        Parameters:
        r - Red component.
        g - Green component.
        b - Blue component.
        a - Alpha component. 0 is transparent.
        Returns:
        RGBA.

      • getColorComponents

        public static int[] getColorComponents(int color)
        Returns the RGBA colors.
        Parameters:
        color - The color.
        Returns:
        RGBA components.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Test program.
        Parameters:
        args - Not used.
